medical_history.chief_complaint: Progressive alopecia and memory loss in association with fatigue.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: Subject A presented with progressive alopecia at age 41, leading to total loss of body hair over 2 years, accompanied by fatigue and memory loss that were diagnosed as endogenous depression in 1992. Symptoms failed to improve despite treatment. Subject B presented with fatigue and forgetfulness for 5 months prior to developing alopecia areata.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Subject A had two children and a maternal grandfather with Addison's disease; subject B had a past medical history of atopic asthma.
medical_history.family_history: Maternal grandfather with Addison's disease and maternal aunt with Graves' disease for subject A; family history not specified for subject B.
